subclass.name: College of the Mad God
subclassFeatures: College of the Mad God|Bard||Mad God|MFoVLovecraft|3

subclass.name: Oath of the Elder Sign
subclassFeatures: Oath of the Elder Sign|Paladin||Elder sign|MFoVLovecraft|3

subclassFeature.name: College of the Mad God
entries: Mitten in der Nacht hören Sie die Musik. Sie beginnt jedes Mal auf die gleiche Weise und steigert sich von einem leisen Dröhnen zu einer ohrenbetäubenden Kakophonie. Der Lärm ist zum Verrücktwerden. Im Wachzustand lernen Ihre Finger, diese Melodie zu imitieren und andere auf Ihr Niveau der Psychose zu bringen.

Manche führen die schrecklichen Albträume auf einen Fluch oder Stress zurück, aber du weißt es besser. Du und andere wie du werden nachts vom Schlagen abscheulicher Trommeln und dem dünnen, monotonen Wimmern verfluchter Flöten gerufen, den Klängen eines verrückten Gottes, der das Chaos des Universums widerhallen lässt und dich auffordert, etwas zu tun. Du weißt nicht, was.

entries.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: Wenn du dem Kolleg des verrückten Gottes auf Stufe 3 beitrittst, erhältst du eine Fertigkeit, die vom Spielleiter für dich ausgewählt wird. Jede Nacht, wenn du eine lange Pause machst, kann dein GM diese Auswahl ändern.

entries.name: Frenzied Strings
entries: Auf Stufe 3 kannst du eine wahnsinnige Melodie spielen, die Kreaturen, die sie hören, in Angst und Schrecken versetzt. Als Aktion wählst du eine Kreatur innerhalb von 30 Fuß, die du sehen kannst. Diese Kreatur muss einen Rettungswurf in Weisheit machen und erleidet bei einem misslungenen Rettungswurf 2d6 psychischen Schaden. Du kannst eine Anzahl bardischer Inspirationswürfel ausgeben, um diesen Schaden um den gewürfelten Betrag zu erhöhen. Eine betäubte Kreatur ist gegen diesen Effekt immun.
Die Anzahl der Kreaturen, die von dieser Fähigkeit betroffen sind, erhöht sich auf zwei auf der 5. Stufe, drei auf der 11. Stufe und vier auf der 17.

subclassFeature.name: Mad Melody
entries: Auf der 6. Stufe kannst du einen bardischen Inspirationswürfel als Aktion ausgeben, um alle Rettungswürfe, die von Kreaturen im Umkreis von 60 Fuß gewürfelt werden, bis zum Beginn deines nächsten Zuges um den gewürfelten Wert zu verringern.

subclassFeature.name: Cacophony
entries: Ab Stufe 14 kannst du als Aktion mit deinem Instrument ein ohrenbetäubendes Geräusch erzeugen. Wenn sich eine Kreatur im Umkreis von 30 Fuß um dich konzentriert, muss sie einen erfolgreichen Rettungswurf gegen deinen Zauber-Save-DC machen oder ihre Konzentration verlieren. Zusätzlich erleiden alle Kreaturen im Umkreis von 10 Fuß um dich 5d6 Donnerschaden. Nachdem du diese Fähigkeit benutzt hast, musst du eine kurze oder lange Pause einlegen, bevor du sie wieder benutzen kannst.

subclassFeature.name: Aberrant Bloodline
entries: Du stammst von einer üblen Kreatur ab, deren Blut in deinem Stammbaum Verwüstung anrichtet. Die Angehörigen deines Hauses werden selten und scheinbar willkürlich mit schrecklichen Kräften geboren, und so hat eine Generation nach der anderen Kindermord an den Abscheulichkeiten begangen. Du bist ein solches Monster, das bei der Geburt verflucht wurde, aber von deiner Mutter vor dem Messer verschont blieb und nun sein elendes Dasein als von der Gesellschaft abgeschnittene Missgeburt fristen kann. Doch deine Macht wächst, so furchterregend wie dein Aussehen und so schrecklich wie dein Blick.

subclassFeature.name: Aberration Blood
entries: Ab der 1. Stufe, wenn du diese Herkunft wählst, ist deine Haut dicker, schuppiger oder pelziger als normal. Wenn du keine Rüstung trägst, ist deine Rüstungsklasse gleich 13 + dein Geschicklichkeitsmodifikator.

Schließlich erhältst du {@sense darkvision} die Fähigkeit, in schwachem Licht im Umkreis von 30 Fuß zu sehen, als wäre es helles Licht, und in der Dunkelheit, als wäre es schwaches Licht. Du kannst in der Dunkelheit keine Farben erkennen, nur Grautöne. Wenn du bereits über Dunkelheitssicht verfügst, erhöht sich deine Reichweite um 30 Fuß.

subclassFeature.name: Hideous Appearance
entries: Auf Stufe 1 ist dein Aussehen abscheulich. Du kannst das Doppelte deines Fertigkeitsbonus auf {@skill Intimidation}-Prüfungen addieren, aber du hast einen Nachteil bei {@skill Persuasion}-Prüfungen. Wenn du keinen großen Umhang trägst, um diese Entstellungen zu verbergen, ist dein Anblick verstörend.

subclassFeature.name: Inhuman Reach
entries: Auf der 6. Stufe verlängern sich deine Arme, so dass du mit deinen Händen den Boden berühren kannst. Außerdem kannst du sie auf seltsame und unnatürliche Weise beugen. Deine Reichweite erhöht sich um 5 Fuß. Deine verlängerten Arme verschaffen dir außerdem einen Vorteil bei Stärke ({@skill Athletics})-Prüfungen zum Klettern.

subclassFeature.name: Tentacles
entries: At 6th level, you can grow long, whipping tendrils that sprout grotesquely from your form as a bonus action expending 2 sorcery points which last for 1 round. When a creature comes within 5 feet of you or begins its turn there, it takes 3d6 bludgeoning damage. You can maintain this effect by expending 2 sorcery points at the beginning of your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Warped Mind
entries: At 14th level, your tainted form has altered the nature of your brain, making you resistant to psychic attacks, and more capable of inflicting them upon others. You gain resistance to psychic damage and have advantage on save against being {@condition charmed}.

Additionally, you can emit a mind blast in a 60-foot cone as an action. Choose a number of sorcery points to expend, to a maximum of 6. Each creature in the cone must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw or take psychic damage equal to 1d8 for each sorcery point expended plus your Intelligence modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Monstrous Transformation
entries: At 18th level, as a bonus action expending 3 sorcery points, you can unleash your monstrous heritage from within your body and transform into a terrible creature. Until you use your bonus action to end this effect, you have resistance to piercing, slashing, and bludgeoning damage, but can't cast spells of 1st level or higher. Each round you begin in this form, you expend 3 additional sorcery points.

In addition, creatures who look upon this form become frozen in horror. Each creature that can see you within 30 feet, except for allies which know to avert their gaze, must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition paralyzed} while you are transformed. At the end of each of its turns, affected creatures can repeat this saving throw. A creature that succeeds this save is immune to this effect for 24 hours.
Once you use this ability, you must finish a long rest before using it again.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of the Elder Sign
entries: Keepers encounter the Elder Sign in a multitude of ways. Some find it in the derelict pages of an antediluvian tome, yet others see its shape in their very dreams. All who gaze upon it know its authority, as instinctively as animals know to fear fire; it is an icon of power originating from beyond the veil of reality, one that no men were meant to know. You have sworn to hold the sign as its Keeper, and vowed to protect the mortal realm from the forces beyond, or vowed to tear reality asunder, and let the Elder Evils henceforth seep through.

entries.name: Tenets of the Pact of the Elder Sign
entries: The principles held by the Keepers of the Elder sign are as esoteric as their ancient order. Dedicated to the secrets of the universe and the keeping them mercifully hidden from the world, the Keepers are a clandestine and influential organization.

entries.name: Keep the Sign
entries: The Elder Sign is a tool of immense power, and must be kept safe. You can scarcely understand the source of power contained in this mere piece of geometry, but you know it can never be allowed to fall into the wrong hands.

entries.name: Seek Knowledge
entries: Whenever possible, you should seek out and acquire hidden, esoteric knowledge. You are drawn to such secrets, like the Elder Sign, and perhaps can turn them against your foes.

entries.name: Go Unseen
entries: It is imperative the struggles you face are kept secret. The forces are work here are barely comprehensible, and their reveal can drive men to the brink of madness.

entries.name: Defend the Gates
entries: It is your job to stand vanguard at the gates that form where our world intersects the Far Realm. You may be protecting it from those who would seek to close it, or you may wish to stem the tide of creatures coming through.

entries.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.

entries.caption: Oath of the Elder Sign Spells
rows: {@spell Arms of Hadar}, {@spell Protection from Evil and Good}

entries.name: Channel Divinity
entries: When you take this oath at 3rd level, you gain the following two Channel Divinity options.

entries.name: Invoke Elder Sign
entries: As an action, you can fleetingly create the form of the Elder Sign, a powerful symbol which can strengthen or wear thin the walls of reality. Choose a space adjacent to you, which is where the sign burns brightly for 1 minute in a 20-foot radius sphere. No darkness, magical or otherwise, can obscure this area. Each creature friendly to you in this area gains a +1 bonus on attack and damage rolls and gains a +1 bonus to armor class. No outsider, an aberration, celestial, elemental, fey, or fiend, can enter or teleport within this area or use portals, such as those created by the gate spell, to enter the area. Those that are already in this area are shunted to the nearest space available. As such, Elder Signs are often placed in front of gates to the Far Realm, to close leaks into that reality.

Alternatively, when you use this ability, you can choose to Invert the Elder Sign. Doing so casts {@spell hunger of hadar} for one minute centered on the sign. You take no damage from this spell on the round it is cast.

entries.name: Glimpse the Unspeakable
entries: As an action, choose one creature you can see within 30 feet. This creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature sees a glimpse of the Far Realm, and is {@condition stunned} with horror until the beginning of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Mental Fortitude
entries: Beginning at 7th level, you and allies within 10 feet of you have immunity to psychic damage. At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Word of Revelation
entries: By 15th level, your research in musty, forbidden tomes has proven fruitful. As an action, you can utter a word used in the creation of the universe. All magic effects within 15 feet of you are targeted by {@spell dispel magic}. After using this ability, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Sunder Reality
entries: At 20th level, you can call upon the Elder Sign to tear the very fabric of reality, creating a one-way rift to or from the Far Realm for 1 minute. Choose an unoccupied 5-foot radius sphere that you can see and whether this portal should lead to, or come from the Far Realm. Creatures that end their turn within 30' of the sphere are inexplicably moved 5 feet toward it, as if pulled by an unseen force. If the portal leads to the Far Realm, creatures that enter it are flung to the far reaches of space, taking 8d10 psychic damage from the horrors they witness and are ejected from the far side of the portal 1 round later. If the portal leads from the Far Realm, creatures adjacent to it are restrained by tentacles, claws, or other monstrous appendages that reach through it. Creatures so restrained can break free as an action by making a Strength saving throw. After using this ability, you cannot use it again until you complete a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of the Unspeakable
entries: Druids of an Unspeakable Circle are abominations to the natural world. Whereas normal druids venerate nature and assume the shape of beasts, Unspeakable druids can transform into creatures originating from terrifying remote regions of time and space. As they grow in power and influence, the other form further mutates from comprehensible physical bodies and becomes more deadly and bizarre. The Masters of this circle transform into hideous monstrosities, unrecognizable as creatures from our own reality.

entries.name: Aberration Form
entries: When you choose this circle at 2nd level, you gain the ability to use {@class druid|phb|Wild Shape|druid||Wild Shape 2} on your turn as a bonus action, rather than as an action, however, you lose the ability to assume the shape of a beast. Instead you may use it to take an Aberration Form with a number of additional traits.
Additionally, animals are instinctively wary of you, giving disadvantage on {@skill Handle Animal} checks.

trait.name: All Around Vision
entries: You add double your proficiency bonus on {@skill Perception} checks involving sight in this form.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw}: {@i your spell attack bonus} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

entries.name: Lesser Traits
entries: At 2nd level, when you assume your Aberration Form, you can choose one of the following traits:

entries.name: Bestial Hide
entries: Your skin is thicker, scalier, or furrier than normal. Your armor class equals 15. At 6th level, your armor class equals to 17.

entries.name: Inhuman Vision
entries: Your eyes are numerously scattered about your body, or are segmented an extremely sensitive to movement. You gain the effects of {@spell see invisibility} at all times. Also, you gain {@sense darkvision}, the ability to see in dim light within 30 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Poison Breath
entries: On you turn, you can create a {@spell poison spray} effect from your mouth as an action.

entries.name: Unnaturally Quick
entries: In spite of your size, you can move inexplicably fast, due in part to two extra legs. Your speed increases by 15 feet. In addition, you also have advantage on Dexterity checks.

subclassFeature.name: Moderate Traits
entries: At 6th level, when you assume your Aberration Form, you can choose one of the following traits:

entries.name: Additional Limbs
entries: You grow and extra set of appendages, which are ambiguously neither arms nor legs. When you take the attack action on your turn, you can use these to attack twice, instead of once.

entries.name: Durable Form
entries: Your maximum hit points increase by an amount equal to your Druid level times two. In addition, you also have advantage on Constitution checks.

entries.name: Inhuman Reach
entries: Your arms elongate, allowing you to touch the floor with your hands. In addition, you can bend them in strange and unnatural ways. Your reach increases by 5 feet. Your elongated arms also give you advantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks made to climb.

entries.name: Razor Claws
entries: Your claws are incredibly deadly, indicative of a hunter not native to this world. Your claws deal {@damage 1d12} slashing damage and are considered magical weapons.

subclassFeature.name: Intermediate Traits
entries: At 10th level, when you assume your Aberration Form, you can choose one of the following traits:

entries.name: Acid Blood
entries: When a creature adjacent to you deals damage to you with a melee attack, your acidic blood sprays on them, dealing {@damage 2d6} acid damage.

entries.name: Colossal Form
entries: Your form is that of a strange, primordial titan. Your size doubles in all dimensions, and your weight is multiplied by eight. This growth increases your size by one category—from Medium to Large, for example. You also have advantage on Strength checks. While you are enlarged, your melee attacks deal 1d4 extra damage.

entries.name: Invisibility
entries: You can phase in and out of the visible spectrum, as if light is a strange afterthought this form has never experienced before. You can cast {@spell invisibility} without using a spell slot. After using this ability, you cannot use it again for 1d4 + 1 rounds.

entries.name: Tentacles
entries: You have long, whipping tendrils that sprout grotesquely from your form. These tendrils automatically attack hostile creatures adjacent to you, each of which must make a Dexterity saving throw at the beginning of your turn. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 4d6} bludgeoning damage, or half as much on a successful one.

subclassFeature.name: Greater Traits
entries: At 14th level, when you assume your Aberration Form, you can choose one of the following traits:

entries.name: Antimagic Eye
entries: You have a single colossal extra eye, which you can open and close as a bonus action. While the eye is open, it requires your concentration, you may cast no spells, and the eye creates an area of antimagic, as per the antimagic field spell, in a 15-foot cone. At the start of each of your turns, you may decide which way the cone faces. Your eye closes if you lose concentration on the effect.

entries.name: Extract Brain
entries: You can remove and consume the brain of a helpless victim. As an action, make an attack against one humanoid that is grappled by you. On a hit, the target takes 6d10 piercing damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, you kill the target by extracting and devouring its brain. This ability has no effect on creatures without nervous systems, such as oozes, elementals, and constructs.

entries.name: Hideous Appearance
entries: Your appearance is profoundly disturbing, even moreso up close. Creatures adjacent to you have disadvantage on melee attacks against you.

entries.name: Membranous Wings
entries: You sprout pronounced, slimy wings and gain a fly speed equal to your movement speed
